intro: Pedicularis pycnantha var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-flowered lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous petals, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
